data: Dr. Emrah Turgut Dr. Emrah Turgut Assistant Professor Ph.D., University of Colorado Boulder, 2014 220M Henry Bellmon Research Center 405-744-5407 emrah.turgut@okstate.edu Lab: 220D Henry Bellmon Research Center Ultrafast Dynamics in Condensed Matter Systems Assistant Professor–Oklahoma State University (2018-Present) Postdoc–Cornell University (2018) PhD in Physics–University of Colorado Boulder (2014) B.S. in Physics–Middle East Technical University (2009) Professional Affiliations Member of IEEE, IEEE Magnetic Society, APS Award and Honors 2012 Best poster UXSS Summer School, SLAC Stanford 2009-2014 Assistantship in the Physics Department University of Colorado at Boulder. 2005-2009 TUBITAK (The Scientific and Technical Research Council of Turkey) Distinguished Bachelor Fellowship 2004-2005 Two gold and two bronze medals in National and International Physics Olympiads held in South Korea, Spain, and Turkey. Early Research Experiences 2008 University of California, Los Angeles, USA Label-free, Ultra-wide-field and Massively Parallel Optical Cell Counting Technologies for HIV and Related Global Health Problems, supervised by Aydogan Ozcan 2007 Middle East Technical University, Ankara, Turkey XPS studies on Si under pressure with computational simulation Quantum-Espresso(PWSCF), supervised by Hande Ustunel
